data.title: ASCII Lover
data.solution:
<?php
$input = trim(stream_get_line(STDIN, 10100 + 1, "\n"));
$inputLen = strlen($input);
$firstChar = ord($input[0]);
$lastChar = ord($input[$inputLen - 1]);

// Make an array with all ASCII characters and their frequency
$asciiFreq = count_chars($input, 0); // Mode 0 gets all present and non-present ASCII charaters and their frequencies

// FILTER OUT DESIRED RANGE
$filterAscii = array_filter($asciiFreq, function ($key) use ($firstChar, $lastChar) {
    return $key >= $firstChar && $key <= $lastChar;
}, ARRAY_FILTER_USE_KEY); // Default will use values instead of keys, so we set ARRAY_FILTER_USE_KEY to access the keys

// OUTPUT
if ($lastChar - $firstChar < 1) echo "Nothing to process\n";
else {
    foreach ($filterAscii as $asciiNum => $freq) {
        echo ($freq < 1 ? "No " : "$freq ") . chr($asciiNum) . "\n";
    }
}
?>
data.statement:
Given a string, output all individual ASCII characters from the range of the first character's ASCII value to the last character's ASCII value (inclusive), along with their frequencies (number of times they appeared in the string) in the format:

[[frequency]] [[ASCII character]] (separated by a space)

Any characters outside of the range should be ignored.
If frequency is 0, output {{No}} instead of [[frequency]].
Output each ASCII character within the range, even if it's not in the input string.
Output should be in the order of ascending ASCII value .
Separate each output with a new line.
If the ASCII value of the first character is <<not smaller>> than the ASCII value of the last character, output:

{{Nothing to process}}

testCases.testOut:

2 B
3 C
2 D
3 E
23 F

data.constraints:
32 ≤ ASCII value of each character in [[input]] ≤ 126
1 ≤ length of [[input]] ≤ 2000
data.inputDescription: A string [[input]] containing ASCII characters with values from 32 to 126.
data.outputDescription:
<<Several lines>>: The frequency and character of all the characters within the required range in ascending order, or
<<1 line>>: {{Nothing to process}}.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a string, output all individual ASCII characters from the range of the first character's ASCII value to the last character's ASCII value (inclusive), along with their frequencies (number of times they appeared in the string) in the format:

frequency ASCII character (separated by a space)

Any characters outside of the range should be ignored.
If frequency is 0, output No instead of frequency.
Output each ASCII character within the range, even if it's not in the input string.
Output should be in the order of ascending ASCII value .
Separate each output with a new line.
If the ASCII value of the first character is not smaller than the ASCII value of the last character, output:

Nothing to process
Input
A string input containing ASCII characters with values from 32 to 126.
Output
Several lines: The frequency and character of all the characters within the required range in ascending order, or
1 line: Nothing to process.
Constraints
32 ≤ ASCII value of each character in input ≤ 126
1 ≤ length of input ≤ 2000
Example
Input
AC
Output
1 A
No B
1 C
